headline: QUIZ: Black people you should know
description: It's like this: We give you a photo of a historical black figure, you pick the correct name for that person.
question: Which historic black figure is this?
blurb: New Yorker and poet Langston Hughes was one of the fathers of the Harlem Renaissance.
result: 0-8 Black History Month is almost over and this is what you come up with? Back to school with you!

question: Which historic black figure is this?
blurb: Huey Newton co-founded the Black Panther Party with Bobby Seale.

question: Which historic black figure is this?
blurb: Josephine Baker went from a street-corner dancer to an international star and French Resistance agent.
result: 13-15 Next Af-Am history class you're the professor.

question: Which historic black figure is this?
blurb: W.E.B. DuBois co-founded the NAACP and wrote a seminal book on being black in the United States, The Souls of Black Folk.

question: Which historic black figure is this?
blurb: You know who Harriet Tubman is.

question: Which historic black figure is this?
blurb: Thurgood Marshall was the first African-American Supreme Court Justice, a director of the NAACP, and a lawyer who argued Brown vs. Board of Education in front of the Supreme Court. He was born with the last name "Thoroughgood" and shortened it to "Thurgood."

question: Which historic black figure is this?
blurb: A. Philip Randolph was a big union organizer in the early 1900s and was also instrumental through much of the Civil Rights Movement. Look him up.

question: Which historic black figure is this?
blurb: Medgar Evers was a leader in the Civil Rights Movement who was assassinated by a Ku Klux Klansman in 1963.

question: Which historic black figure is this?
blurb: Billie Holiday got her start singing in Harlem nightclubs, and went on to record albums, perform in movies, pick up at least one bad habit and die all by the age of 44.

question: Which historic black figure is this?
blurb: The 14-year-old Emmett Till was lynched in 1955 in Mississippi after a white woman lied, saying Till had whistled at her. The reverberations from Till's slaying and its aftermath continue.

question: Which historic black figure is this?
blurb: Born in Harlem, James Bladwin was an essayist, playwright, novelist and social critic. Even though he spent most of his adult life abroad, he never stopped reflecting on his experience as a black man in white America.

question: Which historic black figure is this?
blurb: She was a NASA mathematician who calculated, among many other computations, the trajectory for the space flight of Alan Shepard, the first American in space.

question: Which historic black figure is this?
blurb: Marcus Garvey led the black nationalist movement of the early 1900s. He led the Pan-Africanism movement and founded the Universal Negro Improvement Association.

question: Which historic black figure is this?
blurb: Abolitionist and women's rights activist Sojourner Truth is best known for her improvised speech on racial inequalities, "Ain't I a Woman?" delivered at the Ohio Women's Rights Convention in 1851.

question: Which historic black figure is this?
blurb: Also known as the Hottentot Venus, Sarah Baartman was a South African woman with an unusual body who was exhibited for entertainment purposes.
